title: ISO:  t206s with unique writing on back
author: t206fix

posts.post_title: ISO:  t206s with unique writing on back
posts.post_content:
So, I picked up both of these cards randomly (separate from each other), but it's clear they were once part of the same collection.  The year, position and non-ball point pen suggest that they are partners.  Does anyone out there have any cards similar to these?  In the spirit of Ed's "Howe McCormack" collection, I'd like to reunite some of these cards.  Please let me know if you have any similar cards (even if you don't want to part with them).

thanks!
Pretty sure I've owned a few of these in the past (but none now).  I'll keep an eye out for you.

Hi Tony,

I've had this Mullaney for quite a few years 10+ I think.

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=319363&d=1528763687[/IMG]
Have owned since Jan 2011 ...

I think the Mullaney matches - with the periods at the end of the words.  I don't think the Bell does - looks different.

thx

Cool Idea !!

Yeah, Bell is more from this guy:

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=319406&d=1528821324[/IMG]

I find it interesting that original owner of Bradley places him as "P."  As he had a 14 year career extensively at 3B.  BUT, he did pitch 1 inning in 1901, giving up 4 hits ....:) .....

[quote name="mybuddyinc" post=1786025]Cool Idea !!

Yeah, Bell is more from this guy:

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=319406&d=1528821324[/IMG]

I find it interesting that original owner of Bradley places him as "P."  As he had a 14 year career extensively at 3B.  BUT, he did pitch 1 inning in 1901, giving up 4 hits ....:) .....[/QUOTE]


I have a Hans Lobert that matches this writing and style, I'll try and dig it up

posts.post_title: and another, but the scan is horrible
posts.post_content: [url]https://www.ebay.com/itm/T206-Piedmont-350-Jake-Stahl-No-Glove-Shows-PSA-Good-2-MK/153035319152?hash=item23a19da770:g:zNEAAOSwdjdaA1Mu[/url]
I have a couple of these. I'll sort through my cards tonight and scan some images for you.

Hey Tony, I found this Chappelle while doing some research 
and I remembered you were looking for cards with this writing.
I'm not sure if it's from the same person it looks similar but
the p is different.

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=323384&d=1532099429[/IMG]

[quote name="Pat R" post=1796455]Hey Tony, I found this Chappelle while doing some research 
and I remembered you were looking for cards with this writing.
I'm not sure if it's from the same person it looks similar but
the p is different.

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=323384&d=1532099429[/IMG][/QUOTE]

That's exactly the same.  Very cool, do you own it?
You might get more examples if this was posted in the main card forum.

[quote name="t206fix" post=1796685]That's exactly the same.  Very cool, do you own it?[/QUOTE]

I don't Tony, I came across the scan while doing some research
it sold on ebay back in February of this year.

[quote name="celoknob" post=1796715]You might get more examples if this was posted in the main card forum.[/QUOTE]

That's a match as well.  Thanks for posting!  Now I know there are a lot more out there

Hey Tony,

I came across another one. This Thomas was sold on ebay 
back in Sept. 2016. It doesn't have the lines above and
below the year but it looks like it could have come from
the same collection.

[IMG]http://www.net54baseball.com/attachment.php?attachmentid=328569&d=1536847635[/IMG]

Pat - 

I think that you may be right.  Scanners sometimes filter out the periods that this guy uses, so that may be the case on this one.  

Also a big shout out to you for tipping off on the new one.  Thanks again!  Now I'm up to three.  No lines on the new find, but obviously from the same collection.

reviving an old thread...

anyone see any new ones?

Shout to Ray aka Herbie Moran

I was about to give up on this project... didn't think I'd ever add any

Ray had a Berry with the same markings - thanks for giving him up!

Also, Sonny pointed out a copy of Lundgren on ebay with same markings.  Anyone know this seller?
Glad to help!
